intro: Senecio pseudodensiserratus, commonly known as the serrated senecio, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small yellow flowers are typically clustered in dense heads, giving it a distinctive appearance. Senecio pseudodensiserratus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and drought tolerance.
